required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic and Prognostic Value of PTEN Expression in Functional and Pathological Endometrial Biopsies
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic and Prognostic Value of PTEN Expression in Functional and Pathological Endometrial Biopsies.

brief_summary.textblock: endometrial hyperplasia may progress to endometrial adenocarcinoma. the exact possibility of such progression is not determined. there a need to detect biological markers that can help in detecting high risk cases of patients with endometrial hyperplasia that may progress to endometrial adenocarcinoma. PTEN is a tumor suppressor gene that inhibit cell migration, proliferation and may induce apoptosis in damaged cells. variable expression of PTEN in functional, hyperplastic and neoplastic endometrial tissues may be of great help in detecting cases of hyperplasia that may progress to endometrial adenocarcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock:
Endometrial carcinoma is the most common invasive neoplasm of female genital system. there are two types of endometrial carcinoma, type I represents more than 80% of all cases and almost always preceded by endometrial hyperplasia. However, the malignant potential of endometrial hyperplasia to carcinoma is highly variable and subjected to interobserver variations. so, there is a compelling need to determine a prognostic biological marker that can help in detecting cases of endometrial hyperplasia that may progress to endometrial adenocarcinoma. PTEN is a tumor suppressor gene. it inhibits cell proliferation and migration. PTEN may induce apoptosis in damaged cells. decrease expression of PTEN has been detected in different human neoplasms as melanoma, breast and ovarian carcinomas.
The aim of this study is to investigate the expression of PTEN (by immunohistochemistry) in some endometrial biological conditions as endometrial hyperplasia and primary endometrial adenocarcinoma specimens, and compare such expression to PTEN expression in normal functional/ cyclical endometrial tissue specimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Investigating the Immunohistochemical Expression of PTEN in Different Endometrial Biopsies.
primary_outcome.description: cases of primary endometrial carcinoma and complex endometrial hyperplasia should express mutant form of PTEN compared to functional and simple hyperplastic endometrial tissues.

arm_group.description: cases of normal endometrium will be obtained from hystrectomy specimens done for causes other than hyperplasia or adenocarcinoma, for example; uterine fibroids, uterine prolapse.
cases of endometrial hyperplasia obtained by D&C or hystrectomy will be stained by H&E stain and categorized into typical or atypical hyperplasia.
cases of primary endometrial adenocarcinoma obtained by D&C or hystrectomy operations

intervention.description: formalin fixed, Parraffin embedded endometrial tissues will be sectioned and get stained by the routine Haematoxalin and Eosin stain in addition to immunohistochemical staining by anti-human PTEN antibody.

biospec_descr.textblock: specimens fixed in Formalin and embedded in Parraffin

study_pop.textblock: endometrial specimens and hystrectomy operations will be done in Gyn&Obs Department of Sohag University Hospital and will be prepared in formalin-fixed, Parraffin-embedded blocks. endometrial blocks will be sectioned and stained by H&E stain. from the same blocks, corresponding tissue sections will be staine immunohistochemically by anti-human PTEN antibodies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all cases of endometrial biopsies and hystrectomy specimens diagnosed as endometrial hyperplasia and/or primary endometrial adenocarcinoma.
- all cases of normal endometrium obtained from hystrectomy specimens due to other pathological conditions as prolapsed uteri, uterine leiomyoma and adenomyosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- autolysed samples, very tiny specimens cervical tissues and specimens with histological picture of endometritis.

overall_official.affiliation: a lecturer of pathology, Sohag faculty of medicine
